description.narrative: In 2020/21, the programme is supported by two national partners, Office of the Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation (OPS), and the National Research Council Thailand (NRCT). In additional to the contribution, the partners also play a role in determining the strategic priority areas to align with Thailand's national agenda.
Researchers and academics in Thailand and the UK as primary targets.

The Institutional Links aim to start and develop collaborations between academic groups, departments and institutions in Thailand and the UK, to support the exchange of expertise and research knowledge, establish local hubs for UK-Thailand activities. The Newton Fund Impact Scheme aims to maximise impact from previous Newton Fund activities, by initiating or increasing policy impacts or user engagement, and by initiating or increasing engagement with impact multipliers (e.g. businesses, start-ups, NGOs or charities).

The Newton Fund in Thailand was launched in 2014 as part of the UK's Official Development Assistance (ODA). The Fund aims to aims to build research and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare, and to develop the two partnering countries' research and innovation capacity for long-term sustainable growth. British Council is one of the delivery partners of the Newton Fund. In 2020, British Council Thailand delivered two programmes under Newton Fund; Institutional Links and Newton Fund Impact Scheme.
